pets.source: World Event: Midsummer Fire Festival

pets.name: Blue Clockwork Rocket Bot
pets.description: Jepetto's top-selling toy this season, the bot's new blue chassis has children across Azeroth scrambling for this feisty battle bot.
pets.source: Vendor: World Vendors Cost: 50TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Personal World Destroyer
pets.description: Goblin engineering at its finest. Blueprints based on the massive fel reaver in Hellfire Peninsula.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: De-Weaponized Mechanical Companion
pets.description: The gold standard for sturdy gnomish design, this mechanical critter is the perfect companion for the lonely engineer on the go.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: Crawling Claw
pets.description: This appears to be nothing more than the paw of a small primate. A closer inspection shows that the hand has been dried by centuries of exposure to the sands of Uldum.
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Fossilized Hatchling
pets.description: You stare at her, and she just stares right back. So clever; sometimes it seems as if she's figuring out how to open doors.
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Enchanted Lantern
pets.description: Reduces the likelihood of being eaten by monsters when you enter pitch-black places.
pets.source:
Profession: Enchanting (525)

Formula: Enchanted Lantern

pets.name: Rustberg Gull
pets.description: This bird is a salty veteran of the endless naval battles surrounding Tol Barad--a veteran whose grown plump from picking through the leftovers, that is.
pets.source: Vendor: Quartermaster Brazie Zone: Tol Barad Peninsula Faction: Baradin's Wardens - Honored Cost: 50

pets.name: Clockwork Gnome
pets.description: Thought to be an original construct of the titans, the clockwork gnome has some gears smaller than the eye can see.
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Fox Kit
pets.description: The fighting in Tol Barad has made it difficult to find these kits, and numerous would-be owners have decimated the fox population there as a result.
pets.source:
Drop: Baradin Fox

Zone: Tol Barad Peninsula

pets.name: Tiny Shale Spider
pets.description: The elemental shale spider is no true arachnid, but it has durability and ferocity that make it feared even in Deepholm.
pets.source:
Drop: Jadefang

Zone: Deepholm

pets.name: Landro's Lil' XT
pets.description: Always 'ready to play,' Landro's Lil' XT is almost indistinguishable from the original. Prone to tantrums and narcolepsy.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Worldbreaker

pets.name: Mr. Grubbs
pets.description: The grubs of the Plaguelands are a side effect of necromantic corruption and the massive number of corpses there. Mr. Grubbs is from a particularly acrobatic breed.
pets.source: World Drop: Eastern Plaguelands (requires Fiona's Lucky Charm)

pets.name: Scooter the Snail
pets.description: You'll find him in his shell, exactly where a snail has to be!
pets.source: World Event: Children's Week

pets.name: Magic Lamp
pets.description: Higitus figi- hockity pocki- abracadab- prestidig--oh, pinfeathers!
pets.source: Profession: Enchanting

pets.name: Elementium Geode
pets.description: Often confused by miners as a rare gem, the geode initially makes its presence known by emitting melodic reverberations.
pets.source:
Drop: Elementium Vein, Rich Elementium Vein

Zone: Deepholm, Twilight Highlands, Uldum

pets.name: Landro's Lichling
pets.description: How the goblin Landro Longshot initially came into possession of the lichling remains a mystery, but he was all too eager to wager it in a game of cards.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Worldbreaker

pets.name: Nightsaber Cub
pets.description: Elune made nightsabers silver and black so they could meld into the shadows on a moonlit night.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Twilight of the Dragons

pets.name: Winterspring Cub
pets.description: Winterspring cubs are happiest when frolicking in freshly fallen snow.
pets.source:
Vendor: Michelle De Rum

Zone: Winterspring

Cost: 50TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Legs
pets.description: Wild marsh walkers are dangerously aggressive, but they're loyal and affectionate if you manage to tame them.
pets.source: World Event: Children's Week

pets.name: Pterrordax Hatchling
pets.description: Pterrordax eggs are incubated underneath the fossils of their forebears, allowing the hatchlings to absorb their ancestors' ferocity and intelligence.
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Voodoo Figurine
pets.description: Voodoo figurines were often empowered by flasks of mojo, troll sweat, and the flesh of tribal enemies.
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Guardian Cub
pets.description: Still a little clumsy, this tiny winged lion is learning how to be the best mount it can be!
pets.source: In-Game Shop

pets.name: Hyjal Bear Cub
pets.description: The cubs of Hyjal suffered much during the Cataclysm. On the bright side, the devastation also led to their newfound love of heights and daredevil stunts.
pets.source:
Vendor: Varlan Highbough

Zone: Molten Front

Cost: 1500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Crimson Lasher
pets.description: Native to the ashen soils of the Firelands, the lasher was transplanted to Azeroth with the help of the Guardians of Hyjal.
pets.source:
Vendor: Ayla Shadowstorm

Zone: Molten Front

Cost: 1500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Feline Familiar
pets.description: Ride with the moon (and this furry, whiskered witch) in the dead of night!
pets.source: World Event: Hallow's End Vendor: Chub Zone: Tirisfal Glades Cost: 150 Vendor: Dorothy Zone: Stormwind City Cost: 150

pets.name: Purple Puffer
pets.description: You might think this fish out of water would be a weak opponent... until you see the intensity that lies within its protective bubble.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Throne of the Tides

pets.name: Darkmoon Monkey
pets.description: The monkeys of Azeroth are infamous tricksters, and these beloved companions of the Darkmoon Faire have taken that innate cunning to a whole new level.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Gregarious Grell
pets.description: The grell are embodiments of the wild side of nature. Tame ones are very rare.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Crown of the Heavens

pets.name: Darkmoon Turtle
pets.description: This shelled reptile bravely protects the home on its back with an unwaveringly happy disposition.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Lumpy
pets.description: A stowaway from Greatfather Winter's workshop, this tiny elemental found himself trapped in a present that was stolen by the Abominable Greench.
pets.source: World Event: Feast of Winter Veil

pets.name: Darkmoon Tonk
pets.description: A favorite of children across Azeroth, this tough little toy can withstand even the most aggressive imagination.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Darkmoon Zeppelin
pets.description: Lacking the mines and rockets of its predecessor, this kid-friendly faire prize is a new favorite among Azeroth's children.
pets.source: Vendor: Lhara Zone: Darkmoon Island Cost: 90

pets.name: Sea Pony
pets.description: Despite its diminutive size, it is impossible to miss a sea pony cutting through the water.
pets.source:
Profession: Fishing

Zone: Darkmoon Island

pets.name: Lunar Lantern
pets.description: These magical lanterns are acquired at the Lunar Festival, which celebrates the defeat of the Burning Legion by the free races of Azeroth.
pets.source:
World Event: Lunar Festival

Vendor: Valadar Starsong

Zone: Moonglade

Cost: 50

pets.name: Festival Lantern
pets.description: The light from each lantern honors the soul of an ancestor spirit. During the Lunar Festival, these ghostly elders pass along their wisdom to the current generation.
pets.source:
World Event: Lunar Festival

Vendor: Valadar Starsong

Zone: Moonglade

Cost: 50

pets.name: Darkmoon Cub
pets.description: This snuggly kitten loves to frolic, but sometimes it seems to be chasing things that aren't really there.
pets.source: Vendor: Lhara Zone: Darkmoon Island Cost: 90

pets.name: Eye of the Legion
pets.description: Always watching. Always judging.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Timewalkers: War of the Anicents

pets.name: Porcupette
pets.description: Despite the name you should absolutely never, ever pet it.
pets.source: Drop: Sack of Pet Supplies

pets.name: Sun Darter Hatchling
pets.description: This unique species of faerie dragon is not usually found on Azeroth.
pets.source: Drop: Oddly-Colored Egg

pets.name: Shore Crawler
pets.description: Only found on the shores of Kezan, this lovely sea creature can be a bit snarky.
pets.source:
Vendor: Matty

Zone: Orgrimmar

pets.name: Gilnean Raven
pets.description: Quoth the raven: the last word you said. It gets old.
pets.source:
Vendor: Will Larsons

Zone: Darkshore

pets.name: Terrible Turnip
pets.description: And you thought turnips at the dinner table were bad.
pets.source:
Drop: World Drop

Zone: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Tiny Goldfish
pets.description: This bubble is way worse than a tank.
pets.source:
Vendor: Nat Pagle

Zone: Krasarang Wilds

Faction: The Anglers - Honored

Cost: 250TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Sand Scarab
pets.description: Easily mistaken for a common beetle, the sting of a sand scarab will quickly clear up the misconception should you be unlucky enough to be stung by one.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Tomb of the Forgotten

pets.name: Jade Crane Chick
pets.description: A graceful creature from the isle of Pandaria.
pets.source:
Vendor: Audrey Burnhep, Varzok

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 50TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-SILVERICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Grinder
pets.description: Mogu sorcerers, keepers of the secret to bringing stone to life, prefer these stolid companions over more beastly familiars.
pets.source:
Drop: Karr the Darkener

Zone: Dread Wastes

pets.name: Aqua Strider
pets.description: Water striders serve an important role in Jinyu culture, acting as a mount, means of sending communications, and even a family pet.
pets.source:
Drop: Nalash Verdantis

Zone: Dread Wastes

pets.name: Mechanical Pandaren Dragonling
pets.description: Constructed from a seemingly impossible mass of gears, springs, wires, and a little something special, this dragonling embodies the spirit of Pandaria as seen through an engineer's goggles.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: Jade Owl
pets.description: Jade is naturally rich with life and color, making it the perfect raw material for this gentle companion.  It is said the wind created by their wings can soothe the troubled mind.
pets.source: Profession: Jewelcrafting

pets.name: Sapphire Cub
pets.description: While each cub is crafted in the same fashion, tiny imperfections in the gemstones create a unique personality when imbued with life. They are, however, always playful and friendly.
pets.source: Profession: Jewelcrafting

pets.name: Fishy
pets.description: Many believe (incorrectly) that goldfish have no memories. Trainers who have worked with them know this is clearly not the case and have the bruises to prove it.
pets.source:
Quest: Let Them Burn

Zone: The Jade Forest

pets.name: Darkmoon Rabbit
pets.description: This rabbit is much stronger than it looks.
pets.source:
Drop: Darkmoon Rabbit

Zone: Darkmoon Island

pets.name: Pandaren Water Spirit
pets.description: Water spirits are especially mischievous, and are known to frequent the canals of the Stormstout Brewery.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Imperial Moth
pets.description: The larval form of this moth is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.
pets.source: Profession: Tailoring (Imperial Silk)

pets.name: Imperial Silkworm
pets.description: This plump red caterpillar is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.
pets.source: Profession: Tailoring (Imperial Silk)

pets.name: Darkmoon Hatchling
pets.description: Most of Violet's numerous forest strider hatchlings are turned into Faire fare by Stamp Thunderhorn, though a few are raised as mounts or purchased by adventurers looking for a petite purple pet.
pets.source: Vendor: Lhara Zone: Darkmoon Island Cost: 90

pets.name: Darkmoon Eye
pets.description: Don't even think about cheating now.
pets.source: Drop: Darkmoon Pet Supplies

pets.name: Pandaren Fire Spirit
pets.description: Though it appears to be a vaguely-related cousin to the Cinder Kitten, the two creatures actually share no ancestry.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Pandaren Air Spirit
pets.description: These spirits represent the heart of Pandaria's elemental powers.
pets.source: Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Pandaren Earth Spirit
pets.description: The elements of Pandaria can be cute and playful, until their homeland is threatened.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Giant Bone Spider
pets.description: Found in a dusty egg clutch at the back of Maexxna's lair, these creatures are already undead when they hatch.
pets.source: Drop: Maexxna Zone: Naxxramas

pets.name: Fungal Abomination
pets.description: Loatheb's body is covered in small pods capable of spreading blighted fungal spores up to 1000 yards given proper wind conditions.
pets.source: Drop: Loatheb Zone: Naxxramas

pets.name: Stitched Pup
pets.description: When Gluth died to a band of brave adventurers, these lil' guys were found in the corpse, gnawing on giant, undead bones.
pets.source: Drop: Gluth Zone: Naxxramas

pets.name: Harbinger of Flame
pets.description: Few of these fiery harbingers remain following Ragnaros' defeat in the Firelands.
pets.source: Drop: Sulfuron Harbinger Zone: Molten Core

pets.name: Corefire Imp
pets.description: These tiny flame imps roam the Molten Core in large swarms and can replenish their numbers rapidly.
pets.source:
Drop: Magmadar

Zone: Molten Core

pets.name: Ashstone Core
pets.description: The cooled core of Golemagg, it appears to retain some semi-sentient properties.
pets.source:
Drop: Golemagg the Incinerator

Zone: Molten Core

pets.name: Untamed Hatchling
pets.description: One of Razorgore's eggs that miraculously survived in Blackwing Lair.
pets.source: Drop: Razorgore the Untamed Zone: Blackwing Lair

pets.name: Chrominius
pets.description: Opponents that face this fierce chromatic monstrosity just hope it doesn't have Time Stop!
pets.source: Drop: Chromaggus Zone: Blackwing Lair

pets.name: Death Talon Whelpguard
pets.description: A runt of the Black Talon, left to guard the whelps.
pets.source:
Drop: Broodlord Lashlayer

Zone: Blackwing Lair

pets.name: Viscidus Globule
pets.description: This small globule didn't make it back to Viscidus in time to re-form.
pets.source: Drop: Viscidus Zone: Ahn'Qiraj

pets.name: Anubisath Idol
pets.description: An anubisath idol from the Temple of Ahn'qiraj, infused with ancient qiraji magic.
pets.source: Drop: Emperor Vek'lor Zone: Ahn'Qiraj

pets.name: Mini Mindslayer
pets.description: The bane of many an adventurer, to look into its eyes is to truly know madness.
pets.source: Drop: The Prophet Skeram Zone: Ahn'Qiraj

pets.name: Gusting Grimoire
pets.description: A fel-tainted tome whose secrets are so terrible and bizarre that its pages have taken on an eerie semblance of life. Found on many a warlock's nightstand.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Betrayal of the Guardian

pets.name: Living Sandling
pets.description: Born of sand, these dangerous creatures can form and disperse in the blink of an eye.
pets.source: Drop: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Sunreaver Micro-Sentry
pets.description: Loyal to the Sunreavers from creation, these pint-sized constructs can still pack a punch.
pets.source:
Drop: Haywire Sunreaver Construct

Zone: Isle of Thunder

pets.name: Zandalari Kneebiter
pets.description: This unique raptor was born on the island of Zandalar and transported here along with the rest of the Zandalari army.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Son of Animus
pets.description: Forged in the Throne of Thunder, these tiny creations are servants of the great Dark Animus.
pets.source:
Drop: Animus

Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Spectral Porcupette
pets.description: Something about this creature looks familiar...
pets.source:
Quest: A Large Pile of Giant Dinosaur Bones

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Sunfur Panda
pets.description: These cuddly rascals enjoy basking in the sun, sleeping in the sun, and napping in the sun.
pets.source: Quest: Beasts of Fable

pets.name: Snowy Panda
pets.description: The white fur of the Snowy Panda allows it to hide in the snowbanks of Kun-Lai Summit.
pets.source: Quest: Beasts of Fable

pets.name: Mountain Panda
pets.description: Cousin to the Snowy Panda, Mountain Pandas reside in the lower regions of Kun-Lai Summit.
pets.source: Quest: Beasts of Fable

pets.name: Pygmy Direhorn
pets.description: Don't pet the pointy end. Note: all of the ends are pointy.
pets.source: Drop: Horridon Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Spawn of G'nathus
pets.description: Some Pandaren believe G'nathus to be an ancient Zandalari Loa left behind to guard the waters south of Lei Shen's island citadel.
pets.source: Drop: G'nathus Zone: Townlong Steppes

pets.name: Ji-Kun Hatchling
pets.description: Deadly offspring of the Ancient Mother, Ji-Kun Hatchlings are considered sacred treasures in many cultures.
pets.source:
Drop: Ji-Kun

Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Pierre
pets.description: Every cook's dream wrapped up in a perfect bundle of metal and bolts. Too bad what he cooks up isn't suitable for humanoid consumption. According to Jard's notes, he intends to make this little guy for his friend, Emily Cole.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: Direhorn Runt
pets.description: The Zandalari breed specific Direhorn species for their small size for use as mounts.
pets.source:
Drop: Direhorns

Zone: Isle of Giants

pets.name: Tiny Red Carp
pets.description: The red scales on these fish are believed to be a warning to predators of the Townlong Steppes and the Dread Wastes that their flesh is toxic. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
pets.source: Profession: Fishing

pets.name: Tiny Blue Carp
pets.description: These little guys can be found in the waters of the Timeless Isle, or swimming alongside Jewel Danio or Redbelly Mandarin. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
pets.source: Profession: Fishing

pets.name: Tiny Green Carp
pets.description: It is believed that the green coloration and stripes on the tiny green carp serve as camouflage in the waters of the Jade Forest, Valley of the Four Winds and the Krasarang Wilds. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
pets.source: Profession: Fishing

pets.name: Tiny White Carp
pets.description: These hardy fish can survive in a wide range of climates, from the snow capped mountains of Kun-Lai Summit to the temperate, salty waters of the oceans around Pandaria. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
pets.source: Profession: Fishing

pets.name: Zandalari Anklerender
pets.description: These tiny minions of Zandalar are adept at stowing away within the cargo holds of the enormous Zandalari warships.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Zandalari Footslasher
pets.description: Even at this size, these raptors can eviscerate an entire cow in less than 10 seconds.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Zandalari Toenibbler
pets.description: These adorable beasts are both cuddly and huggable, provided you do not enjoy having a face.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Lil' Bad Wolf
pets.description: The oft-forgotten offspring of the Big Bad Wolf, found gorged and asleep in a basket of sweets.
pets.source: Drop: The Big Bad Wolf Zone: Karazhan

pets.name: Menagerie Custodian
pets.description: Primary responsibilities include dusting Medivh's many magical artifacts, an activity which has claimed the life, sanity, or physical composition of the many caretakers preceding Moroes.
pets.source: Drop: The Curator Zone: Karazhan

pets.name: Netherspace Abyssal
pets.description: Upon leaving Netherspace, Malchezaar's Abyssals become strangely distorted by Karazhan's magical protections, rendering them tiny, and much less likely to spontaneously erupt in flames.
pets.source: Drop: Prince Malchezaar Zone: Karazhan

pets.name: Fiendish Imp
pets.description: A minion of Terestian Illhoof, this tricky imp was left in Karazhan when the portal to the Twisting Nether closed behind it.
pets.source:
Drop: Terestian Illhoof

Zone: Karazhan

pets.name: Tideskipper
pets.description: An astounding find for the scientific community of Azeroth, who have long pondered, often in taverns, what a baby Sea Giant might look like.
pets.source:
Drop: Morogrim Tidewalker

Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Tainted Waveling
pets.description: The spawn of Hydross, considered by the elemental community to be the "Earl of Puddles."
pets.source:
Drop: Hydross the Unstable

Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Coilfang Stalker
pets.description: It is unknown how Lady Vashj empowers these Fen Striders with their mind-bending powers; even at an early age this creature shows significant psychic ability.
pets.source: Drop: Lady Vashj Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Pocket Reaver
pets.description: Sent through the Twisting Nether by the great Archimonde the Defiler to terrorize tiny civilizations with their medium-sized stomping noises.
pets.source:
Drop: Void Reaver

Zone: Tempest Keep

pets.name: Lesser Voidcaller
pets.description: The lanterns carried by Voidcallers bridge the realms of the living and the dead, and often attract wayward ghosts and spirits.
pets.source:
Drop: High Astromancer Solarian

Zone: Tempest Keep

pets.name: Phoenix Hawk Hatchling
pets.description: These brightly-colored dragonhawks carry Kael'thas' forces swiftly and unerringly through the nether storm surrounding the Eye.
pets.source: Drop: Al'ar Zone: Tempest Keep

pets.name: Gahz'rooki
pets.description: The trolls have a long and storied history of summoning hydras. While he might not be the biggest or strongest hydra, Gahz'rooki will bite your fingers quite hard if you get too close.
pets.source: Vendor: Ravika Zone: Durotar Cost: 1 Vendor: Tenuki Zone: Durotar Cost: 1

pets.name: Living Fluid
pets.description: The dark pools in Primordius' chamber laid stagnant after the fall of the mogu, and murky thoughts began to coalesce.
pets.source: Drop: Primordius Zone: Throne of Thunder Difficulty: Looking For Raid

pets.name: Viscous Horror
pets.description: These malicious oozes are highly sensitive to Primordius' pheromone signature.
pets.source: Drop: Primordius Zone: Throne of Thunder Difficulty: Normal or Heroic

pets.name: Filthling
pets.description: Battle pet trainers are strongly encouraged to wash their hands for at least 30 minutes after playing with the filthling.
pets.source: Drop: Quivering Filth

pets.name: Rascal-Bot
pets.description: This little guy seems to like to hang out at the fringes of cataclysmic events. There is no evidence to suggest he has anything to do with the cause of these events, though - he's probably just an observer. Or maybe he just gets lost on his trek to other places.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: Moon Moon
pets.description: Moonfang's cubs grow into massive, slavering, black-furred killing machines...except for Moon Moon.
pets.source: Drop: Moonfang Zone: Darkmoon Island

pets.name: Lil' Bling
pets.description: This handsome little robot is the spitting image of his "Dad", Blingtron 4000. As a Blingtron's generosity circuits don't mature until they have been built to maximum specification, you shouldn't expect any free handouts from him.
pets.source: Drop: Blingtron Gift Package

pets.name: Azure Crane Chick
pets.description: Crane chicks of the Timeless Isle sometimes sing a curious song that calms the nerves and soothes the soul.
pets.source:
Drop: Crane Nest

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Blackfuse Bombling
pets.description: The first bombling created in the Underhold, Siegecrafter Blackfuse couldn't bear to see it destroyed, and kept it as a friendly, if explosive, pet.
pets.source: Drop: Siegecrafter Blackfuse Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

pets.name: Ashleaf Spriteling
pets.description: The Ashleaf Sprites of the Timeless Isle tirelessly protect the vegetation of the island from the burning fury of Ordos and his minions.
pets.source:
Drop: Leafmender

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Ruby Droplet
pets.description: The waters of Ruby Lake are colored a strange reddish hue, possibly due to the ruby crystals found deep within the mountains of the Timeless Isle.
pets.source:
Drop: Garnia

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Dandelion Frolicker
pets.description: While fascinated by flowers, the frolicker has also been known to dance with blades of grass and the occasional weed.
pets.source:
Drop: Scary Sprite

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Death Adder Hatchling
pets.description: Late in life, if the environmental conditions are correct, a Death Adder may shed its skin and undergo a transformation into an Imperial Python.
pets.source:
Drop: Imperial Python

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Droplet of Y'Shaarj
pets.description: A small remnant of the power of Y'shaarj that spawned the Sha, a single Drop of Y'shaarj can magnify emotional states for thousands of yards, causing entire towns to shut down in fear or doubt.
pets.source: Drop: Sha of Pride Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar Difficulty: Flexible, Normal or Heroic

pets.name: Gooey Sha-ling
pets.description: Sha-lings reflect the emotional state of their handler, becoming agitated, depressed, fearful, or doubtful depending on the magnitude of negative thoughts around them.
pets.source:
Drop: Sha of Pride

Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

Difficulty: LFR and Flexible

pets.name: Jademist Dancer
pets.description: The Jademist Dancers of the Timeless Isle have a curious attraction to the steam vents of the northwestern shore.
pets.source:
Drop: Jademist Dancer

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Kovok
pets.description: The tiny terror of the Dread Wastes, Kovok prefers a steady diet of "brain food:" mushan brains, human brains, any brains really. This strange nutritional requirement may be tangentally related to his enormous head.
pets.source:
Drop: Paragons of the Klaxxi

pets.description: Eternally cute.
pets.source: Drop: Darkshade Zone: Val'sharah

pets.source: Vendor: Draemus Zone: Dalaran Cost: 200

pets.description: Don't want to break the bank on that new robot? Have a little helper at half the cost! Come down to Goblin Experimental Engineering Korporation and put in your order! All sales final.
pets.source: Drop: Blingtron 6000 Gift Package

pets.name: Leyline Broodling
pets.description: When demons, nightmares, and magic collide!

pets.description: Isn't baby elderhorn an oxymoron?
pets.source: Vendor: Ransa Greyfeather Zone: Highmountain Faction: Highmountain Tribe - Revered Cost: 500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.description: Val'kyr are considered "sunborne" when they are honored in the presence of Odyn.
pets.source: Vendor: Valdemar Stormseeker Zone: Stormheim Faction: Valarjar - Revered Cost: 500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Trigger
pets.description: Ever wanted to cuddle with a gun? Introducing Trigger, the Cuter Shooter.
pets.source: Profession: Engineering

pets.name: Wyrmy Tunkins
pets.description: In his home realm, he commanded an army of ten million demons. Now his power is yours to command. Go make him fight a chicken!
pets.source: Profession: Archaeology

pets.name: Felbat Pup
pets.description: A felbat's fire never burns its master.
pets.source: World Event: Legion Invasion

pets.name: Pygmy Owl
pets.description: No size jokes, please.
pets.source: Drop: Gorebeak Zone: Val'sharah

pets.name: Sting Ray Pup
pets.description: These fast and nimble swimmers are highly desired by pet collectors. Though they can appear friendly, their tail stinger can kill on contact.
pets.source: Vendor: Conjurer Margoss Zone: Dalaran Faction: Conjurer Margoss - Friendly Cost: 50

pets.name: Transmutant
pets.description: When alchemy goes wrong... So, so, wrong.
pets.source: Profession: Alchemy

pets.name: Untethered Wyrmling
pets.description: A wyrmlings temperment hinges primarily on how long its been since its fed on mana. Remember to feed your pets.
pets.source:
Quest: Balance to Spare

Zone: Suramar

pets.name: Lurking Owl Kitten
pets.description: It's a bird! It's a cat! It's... biting me...
pets.source: Quest: You've Got to Be Kitten Me Right Meow Zone: Suramar

pets.name: Hungering Claw
pets.description: Thousands of years ago, ten magisters were exiled from Highborne society for seeking power in the corrupting darkness. In the wilds, they found hunger, desperation, and Kosumoth.
pets.source: Drop: Kosumoth the Hungering

pets.name: Ash'ana
pets.description: One of Ash'alah's litter, entrusted to you by the Dreamweavers.
pets.source: Vendor: Sylvia Hartshorn Zone: Val'sharah Faction: Dreamweavers - Revered Cost: 500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Firebat Pup
pets.description: Fire it up!
pets.source: Mission: Friends, Not Food

pets.name: Corgnelius
pets.description: True royalty among Corgis.
pets.source: Mission: It's so FLUFFY!

pets.name: Court Scribe
pets.description: Ghosts are voracious readers.
pets.source:
Vendor: Veridis Fallon

Zone: Azsuna

Faction: Court of Farondis - Revered

Cost: 500TINTERFACEMONEYFRAMEUI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Benax
pets.description: Younger brother to Anax.  Big brother to Cenax and Denax.
pets.source:
Drop: Anax

Zone: Suramar

pets.name: Noblegarden Bunny
pets.description: Why do bunnies lay eggs?
pets.source: World Event: Noblegarden Vendor: Noblegarden Merchant Cost: 100

pets.name: Igneous Flameling
pets.description: Who's ready for a hot stone massage?
pets.source: World Event: Midsummer Fire Festival Vendor: Midsummer Merchant, Midsummer Supplier Cost: 350

pets.name: Dreadmaw
pets.description: Deep beneath the Argent Tournament grounds a clutch of eggs belonging to mates Acidmaw and Dreadscale was found.
pets.source:
Drop: Icehowl

Zone: Trial of the Crusader

pets.name: Snobold Runt
pets.description: Really much more tolerable when he's not riding on your head.
pets.source: Drop: Icehowl Zone: Trial of the Crusader

pets.name: Nerubian Swarmer
pets.description: Thousands of these skittering nightmares swarm underneath Northrend to this day.
pets.source: Drop: Anub'arak Zone: Trial of the Crusader

pets.name: Magma Rageling
pets.description: In the eternal balance of frost and fire, the raging flames fuel many aggressive fronts.
pets.source:
Drop: Ignis the Furnace Master

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Ironbound Proto-Whelp
pets.description: The denizens of Ulduar transformed even small whelps into ironclad monstrosities.
pets.source:
Drop: Razorscale

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Runeforged Servitor
pets.description: The runeforged sentries of Ulduar march endlessly without the need for rest or recharging.
pets.source:
Drop: Iron Council

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Sanctum Cub
pets.description: Rub its belly more than twice and you're just asking to be pounced on.
pets.source: Drop: Auriaya Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Winter Rageling
pets.description: In the eternal balance of frost and fire, the stolid ice forms a defense without measure.
pets.source:
Treasure: Cache of Winter

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Snaplasher
pets.description: Glowing from within, these sprouts have been blessed with a gift from Eonar.
pets.source: Treasure: Freya's Gift Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: G0-R41-0N Ultratonk
pets.description: The next level of scrapbot technology: pushes the scrap into a heap, then destroys it with flame vents and rockets.
pets.source:
Treasure: Cache of Innovation

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Creeping Tentacle
pets.description: There is something deeply unsettling about the tentacle, perhaps it is best not to look at it for too long.
pets.source:
Drop: Yogg-Saron

Zone: Ulduar

pets.name: Boneshard
pets.description: A small fragment of Lord Marrowgar, it will NOT stop assaulting your shins.
pets.source:
Drop: Lord Marrowgar

Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Blood Boil
pets.description: It really seems to want to touch you, but why?
pets.source: Treasure: Deathbringer's Cache Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Blightbreath
pets.description: The eternal answer to the question 'what's that smell?'
pets.source: Drop: Professor Putricide Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Soulbroken Whelpling
pets.description: The Lich King tore the spirits of Sindragosa's lost whelps into undeath in front of her skeletal form as a final affront to the great dragon.
pets.source: Drop: Sindragosa Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Drudge Ghoul
pets.description: One of innumerable ghouls summoned by the Lich King in his final battle, left to roam the world for eternity.
pets.source:
Drop: The Lich King

Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Wicked Soul
pets.description: An unrepentant soul that was once trapped inside Frostmourne, and now flits restlessly between worlds.
pets.source:
Drop: The Lich King

Zone: Icecrown Citadel

pets.name: Albino Buzzard
pets.description: Crysa has collected many exotic avians in her travels, none more rare than this hatchling.
pets.source: Drop: Torn Sack of Pet Supplies

pets.name: Everliving Spore
pets.source: Drop: Damp Pet Supplies

pets.name: Cavern Moccasin
pets.description: This serpent seems used to being at your side, it may have been the companion of one of the other druids of the fang.
pets.source: Drop: Damp Pet Supplies

pets.name: Young Venomfang
pets.description: Untouched by the deviate corruption seeping through the Wailing Caverns.
pets.source: Drop: Damp Pet Supplies

pets.name: Dibbler
pets.description: This tiny robot specializes in drilling, clamping, and shooting lightning out of its brain. A typical gnome invention.
pets.source: Drop: Leprous Sack of Pet Supplies

pets.name: Naxxy
pets.description: It's just constantly barfing plague fluid. Where does it come from? Where does it go?
pets.source: World Event: Hallow's End Vendor: Woim Zone: Tirisfal Glades Cost: 150 Vendor: Pippi Zone: Stormwind Cost: 150

pets.name: Scraps
pets.description: He's one cowardly companion, because he's got no guts...
pets.source: Drop: Curious Wyrmtongue Cache Zone: Broken Shore

pets.name: Orphaned Felbat
pets.description: Sure are a lot of these around the Broken Shore.
pets.source: World Event: Legionfall Chest

pets.name: Sneaky Marmot
pets.description: This marmot has been with you this entire time. He's that good.
pets.source: Drop: Pickpocket

pets.name: Dig Rat
pets.description: Rogues often kept a few of these in their pockets in times of emergency. Don't ask me why.
pets.source: Drop: Pickpocket

pets.name: Bronze Proto-Whelp
pets.description: The Bronze Proto-Whelps have been discovered only in the most peculiar of timelines.
pets.source: Drop: Time-Lost Wallet Scenario: The Deaths of Chromie

pets.name: Ageless Bronze Drake
pets.description: This particular drake has oddly retained its age throughout its travels, but its size has certainly changed.
pets.source: Drop: Time-Lost Wallet Scenario: The Deaths of Chromie

pets.name: Ghost Shark
pets.description: Queen Azshara's curse over the denizens of Azsuna did not only affect the night elves. This shark is doomed to an eternity of bottomless hunger.
pets.source: Profession: Fishing Vendor: Ilyssia of the Waters Zone: Azsuna Cost: 50

pets.name: Tinytron
pets.description: During their years-long war with the black dragonflight, the dwarves tried crafting smaller golems that were more difficult to hit.
pets.source: Drop: Magmatron Zone: Blackwing Descent

pets.name: Discarded Experiment
pets.description: Maloriak was nothing if not resourceful, not letting even small scraps of flesh go to waste.
pets.source: Drop: Maloriak Zone: Blackwing Descent

pets.name: Rattlejaw
pets.description: Nefarian's reanimated bone constructs were an effective way to combat the many adventurers that plagued him, and especially their mages.
pets.source: Drop: Nefarian Zone: Blackwing Descent

pets.name: Twilight Clutch-Sister
pets.description: Even very small things can be corrupted, the apocalypse is for everyone.
pets.source: Drop: Valiona Zone: The Bastion of Twilight

pets.name: Bound Stream
pets.description: Amongst the rudest of the Twilight's Hammer's corrupting activities was binding the elements of small streams and brooks.
pets.source: Drop: Elementium Monstrosity Zone: The Bastion of Twilight

pets.name: Faceless Minion
pets.description: It has no eyes, but it always seems to be staring at you.
pets.source: Drop: Cho'gall Zone: The Bastion of Twilight

pets.name: Zephyrian Prince
pets.description: A minor diety of wind, lording over the tiny breezes that make you think the heat of the summer season will be bearable for a brief moment.
pets.source: Drop: Al'Akir Zone: Throne of the Four Winds

pets.name: Drafty
pets.description: If you feel a slight gust that made you shiver, that was probably Drafty.
pets.source: Drop: Nezir Zone: Throne of the Four Winds

pets.name: Blazehound
pets.description: Some say it's the pup of Riplimb and Rageface, others say 'I don't want to think about that.'
pets.source: Drop: Shannox Zone: Firelands

pets.name: Cinderweb Recluse
pets.description: A rarely-seen cinderweb species known for devouring her mate's legs and laying eggs in his still-twitching body, and a lovely purple color.
pets.source: Drop: Beth'tilac Zone: Firelands

pets.name: Surger
pets.description: Five things he can never do without: surging, surging, surging, surging, surging.
pets.source: Drop: Baleroc Zone: Firelands

pets.name: Infernal Pyreclaw
pets.description: During his time in the Firelands, Fandral would often grow bored and work shaping magic on the local flora and fauna.
pets.source: Drop: Majordomo Staghelm Zone: Firelands

pets.name: Faceless Mindlasher
pets.description: Can't quite take over your mind, but capable of giving you a really bad migraine.
pets.source: Drop: Yor'sahj the Unsleeping Zone: Dragon Soul

pets.name: Corrupted Blood
pets.description: Some fragments of Deathwing's blood live on to this day, deep within the lost places of the world, forever seeking their lost host.
pets.source: Treasure: Greater Cache of the Aspects

pets.name: Unstable Tendril
pets.description: Its friends call it "Slappy."
pets.source: Treasure: Elementium Fragment

pets.name: Fel Lasher
pets.description: Beautiful and deadly.
pets.source: Profession: Herbalism

pets.name: Docile Skyfin
pets.description: Skyfin can be observed in a wide variety of colors. Biologists believe the vibrancy of those colors both help attract mates and ward predators.
pets.source: Drop: Fel-Spotted Egg

pets.name: Fel-Afflicted Skyfin
pets.description: Watch out when it spits.
pets.source: Drop: Fel-Spotted Egg

pets.name: Grasping Manifestation
pets.description: Reaching out from some vast unknown corner of the void... to give you a hug.
pets.source: Drop: Ataxon Zone: Mac'Aree

pets.name: Fossorial Bile Larva
pets.description: If a bile larva stays burrowed for an extended period of time they begin to lose their pigment. When they finally do emerge, they can be quite ravenous.
pets.source: Profession: Skinning

pets.name: Rebellious Imp
pets.description: What are they rebelling against? The real question is what are they NOT rebelling against.
pets.source: Drop: Mother Rosula
